column4: When you do an upgrade from the ISO - you have to use the alternate CD right?
I understood that to be the case, but have been informed that it may be broken
broken?
all I have is this: http://pastebin.com/me18e45a I'll be trying it myself before long
According to the bugsite - the fix was pushed out in feb
maybe that guy has an old iso
could be, I know nothing, just yet
only 1 more minute on the download - plus a few for the burn - so we'll see
you can just mount the ISO without burning it
good point
mount -o loop name.iso /dir/to/mnt
ty
./cdromupgrade
does work?
looks like there's an error after all
no - it complains about that tar file missing
I wonder if one can add the CD as a repo
It works
Give it the full path when you exec it
debrac@zazu:/media/iso$ sudo /media/iso/cdromupgrade
ok, good deal
aww man - it wants to remove my apache and VLC
both beyond my needs/knowledge... conflicts with other packages?
